text: first of all your reaction to Nigel
Farage stepping down well I want to be
generous he spent 20 years pushing for a
referendum we had the referendum and it
was won by 17 a half million people and
he played a role in that and you know
but you're pleased to see him go well
I'll be honest um six months ago I was
talking about the need for change I i do
think all parties benefit it may not
look like it today this week but all
parties ultimately benefit from having
these internal democratic inclusive
contests because its way of generating
new ideas and allowing the most able to
get to the top don't hold back you
tweeted a smiley face when he announced
Nigel Farage he was stepping down I
tweet smiley faces all the time I'm very
optimistic not a smiley face and I woke
up first thing this morning so you're
happy about it there is a huge
opportunity here the cartel parties in
Westminster have for years taken for
granted their electorates seventy
percent of Labour MPs represent
constituencies where a majority of
people wanted to leave the EU of the
noble exceptional people like Jesus
Church most Labour MPs are fundamentally
out of touch with the views and that's a
huge opportunity for us thank you
